What does HTTP status code 100 mean?

options.choice: Continue – the client should continue its request
Processing – the server has received and is processing the request
Switching Protocols – the server is switching to the protocol requested

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 101 mean?

options.choice: Switching Protocols – the server is switching to the protocol requested
Continue – the client should continue its request
Created – the request has succeeded and a new resource was created
Bad Request – the server could not understand the request

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 102 mean?

options.choice: Processing – server has received and is processing the request
Early Hints – preliminary response to speed up resource loading
Non-Authoritative Information – the returned meta-information is from a local copy
Reset Content – server successfully processed request; client should reset view

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 103 mean?

options.choice: Early Hints – server is likely to send final response after the hints
Processing – server is processing in background
Multiple Choices – several options for the resource
Partial Content – server is delivering only part of the resource

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 200 mean?

options.choice: Accepted – request has been accepted for processing
No Content – server successfully processed request; no content to return
Created – request has succeeded and a new resource was created

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 201 mean?

options.choice: Created – request has succeeded and created a new resource
No Content – server processed request; no content to return
Bad Request – server could not understand request
Moved Permanently – resource has been permanently moved

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 202 mean?

options.choice: Accepted – request has been accepted for processing, but not completed
Non-Authoritative Information – meta-information from a local copy
Reset Content – server processed request; client should reset view
Forbidden – server understood request but refuses to authorize it

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 203 mean?

options.choice: Non-Authoritative Information – meta-information is from a local or third-party copy
Partial Content – server is delivering part of the resource
Already Reported – members of DAV binding reported already
Switching Protocols – server is switching protocols

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 204 mean?

options.choice: No Content – server processed request; no content to return
Reset Content – server processed request; client should reset view
Not Modified – resource has not been modified since last request

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 205 mean?

options.choice: Reset Content – server processed request; client should reset view
No Content – server processed request; no content to return
Partial Content – server is delivering part of the resource
Conflict – request could not be completed due to conflict

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 206 mean?

options.choice: Partial Content – server is delivering part of the resource
Early Hints – preliminary response to speed up loading
Unsupported Media Type – server refuses to accept request body format

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 207 mean?

options.choice: Multi-Status – multiple separate responses in a single message
Already Reported – members of DAV binding reported already
Im Used – server has fulfilled a GET request for the resource

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 208 mean?

options.choice: Already Reported – members of DAV binding have already been enumerated
IM Used – server has fulfilled a GET request for the resource
Loop Detected – server detected an infinite loop

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 226 mean?

options.choice: IM Used – server has fulfilled a GET request for the resource
Already Reported – members of DAV binding reported already
Partial Content – server is delivering part of the resource
Upgrade Required – client should switch to a different protocol

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 300 mean?

options.choice: Multiple Choices – there are multiple options for the resource
Moved Permanently – resource has been permanently moved
See Other – client should retrieve resource from another URI
Not Modified – resource has not been modified

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 301 mean?

options.choice: Moved Permanently – resource has been permanently moved to a new URI
Found – resource resides temporarily under a different URI
See Other – client should use GET on another URI
Temporary Redirect – resource resides temporarily under a different URI

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 302 mean?

options.choice: Found – resource resides temporarily under a different URI
Moved Permanently – resource has been permanently moved
See Other – client should retrieve resource from another URI
Not Modified – resource has not been modified

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 303 mean?

options.choice: See Other – client should retrieve resource using GET at another URI
Found – resource resides temporarily under a different URI
Use Proxy – client should use a proxy to access the resource
Not Modified – resource has not been modified

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 304 mean?

options.choice: Not Modified – resource has not been modified since last request
No Content – server processed request; no content to return
Multiple Choices – there are multiple options for the resource
Temporary Redirect – resource resides temporarily elsewhere

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 305 mean?

options.choice: Use Proxy – requested resource must be accessed through the proxy given by Location
Temporary Redirect – resource resides temporarily under a different URI
Forbidden – server refuses to authorize request
Multiple Choices – there are multiple options for the resource

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 306 mean?

options.choice: Switching Protocols – server is switching protocols
Already Reported – members of DAV binding reported already

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 307 mean?

options.choice: Temporary Redirect – resource resides temporarily under a different URI; method not changed
Found – resource resides temporarily under a different URI; may change method
Permanent Redirect – resource has been permanently moved
See Other – client should use GET on another URI

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 308 mean?

options.choice: Permanent Redirect – resource has been permanently moved; method not changed
Moved Permanently – resource has been permanently moved; method may change
Temporary Redirect – resource resides temporarily elsewhere
See Other – client should use GET on another URI

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 400 mean?

options.choice: Bad Request – server could not understand the request
Forbidden – server understood request but refuses to authorize
Not Found – resource could not be found

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 401 mean?

options.choice: Unauthorized – authentication is required and has failed or not yet provided
Forbidden – server understood request but refuses to authorize
Payment Required – reserved for future use
Bad Request – server could not understand the request

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 402 mean?

options.choice: Payment Required – reserved for future use
Forbidden – server refuses to authorize request
Conflict – request could not be completed due to conflict
Too Many Requests – client has sent too many requests

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 403 mean?

options.choice: Forbidden – server understood request but refuses to authorize it
Not Found – resource could not be found
Bad Request – server could not understand request

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 404 mean?

options.choice: Not Found – the requested resource could not be found
Gone – resource is no longer available
Forbidden – server refuses to authorize request
Bad Request – server could not understand request

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 405 mean?

options.choice: Method Not Allowed – request method is known but not supported by resource
Not Acceptable – resource cannot generate content acceptable by client
Conflict – request could not be completed due to conflict
Payload Too Large – request entity is larger than limits

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 406 mean?

options.choice: Not Acceptable – server cannot generate content acceptable by client
Unsupported Media Type – server refuses to accept request body format
Precondition Failed – a precondition given by client failed
Expectation Failed – server cannot meet Expect header requirements

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 407 mean?

options.choice: Proxy Authentication Required – client must authenticate with proxy
Forbidden – server refuses to authorize request
Payment Required – reserved for future use

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 408 mean?

options.choice: Request Timeout – client did not produce a request within the time server was prepared to wait
Gateway Timeout – server acting as gateway timed out waiting for upstream server
Too Early – server is unwilling to risk processing
Service Unavailable – server is currently unable to handle request

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 409 mean?

options.choice: Conflict – request could not be completed due to conflict with current state
Gone – resource is no longer available
Precondition Required – server requires request to be conditional
Bad Request – server could not understand request

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 410 mean?

options.choice: Gone – resource is no longer available and will not be available again
Not Found – resource could not be found
Multiple Choices – there are multiple options for the resource
No Content – server processed request; no content to return

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 411 mean?

options.choice: Length Required – server refuses request without Content-Length header
Precondition Failed – a condition given in request header fields failed
Payload Too Large – request entity is larger than limits
Not Acceptable – server cannot generate acceptable content

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 412 mean?

options.choice: Precondition Failed – one or more preconditions given in request header fields evaluated to false
Expectation Failed – server cannot meet Expect header requirements
Length Required – server refuses without Content-Length header
Unsupported Media Type – server refuses request body format

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 413 mean?

options.choice: Payload Too Large – request entity is larger than limits defined by server
Request Entity Too Large – deprecated name for 413
URI Too Long – request URI is too long
Request Header Fields Too Large – headers too large

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 414 mean?

options.choice: URI Too Long – request URI is longer than server can handle
Payload Too Large – request entity is larger than server limits
Bad Request – server could not understand request
Unsupported Media Type – server refuses request body format

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 415 mean?

options.choice: Unsupported Media Type – server refuses to accept request body format
Not Acceptable – server cannot generate acceptable content
Bad Request – server could not understand request

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 416 mean?

options.choice: Range Not Satisfiable – client asked for a portion of the file not available
Partial Content – server is delivering part of the resource
Requested Range Not Satisfiable – deprecated name for 416
Precondition Failed – a precondition given in header fields failed

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 417 mean?

options.choice: Expectation Failed – server cannot meet the requirements of the Expect header
Precondition Failed – one or more preconditions given in header fields evaluated to false
Failed Dependency – request failed due to failure of a previous request
Forbidden – server refuses to authorize request

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 418 mean?

options.choice: I'm a Teapot – April Fools’ joke; server refuses to brew coffee in teapot
Unprocessable Entity – server understands request but cannot process instructions
Bad Request – server could not understand request

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 421 mean?

options.choice: Misdirected Request – request was directed at a server that is not able to produce a response
Bad Gateway – server received an invalid response from upstream
Failed Dependency – request failed due to failure of a previous request
Network Authentication Required – client needs to authenticate to gain network access

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 422 mean?

options.choice: Unprocessable Entity – server understands request but cannot process instructions
Unsupported Media Type – server refuses to accept request body format
Expectation Failed – server cannot meet Expect header requirements
Too Early – server is unwilling to risk processing

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 423 mean?

options.choice: Locked – the resource that is being accessed is locked
Conflict – request could not be completed due to conflict
Forbidden – server refuses to authorize request

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 424 mean?

options.choice: Failed Dependency – request failed due to failure of a previous request
Precondition Failed – one or more preconditions given in header fields failed
Loop Detected – server detected an infinite loop
Internal Server Error – generic server error

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 425 mean?

options.choice: Too Early – server is unwilling to risk processing a request that might be replayed
Bad Gateway – server received an invalid response from upstream
Request Timeout – client did not produce a request within the time server was prepared to wait
Precondition Required – server requires request to be conditional

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 426 mean?

options.choice: Upgrade Required – client should switch to a different protocol
Bad Request – server could not understand request
Switching Protocols – server is switching protocols

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 428 mean?

options.choice: Precondition Required – server requires request to be conditional
Precondition Failed – one or more preconditions given in header fields failed
Expectation Failed – server cannot meet Expect header requirements
Forbidden – server refuses to authorize request

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 429 mean?

options.choice: Too Many Requests – user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time
Service Unavailable – server is currently unavailable
Gateway Timeout – server acting as gateway timed out
Request Timeout – client did not produce a request in time

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 431 mean?

options.choice: Request Header Fields Too Large – server is unwilling to process request because headers are too large
Payload Too Large – request entity is larger than limits
URI Too Long – request URI is longer than server can handle
Bad Request – server could not understand request

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 451 mean?

options.choice: Unavailable For Legal Reasons – server is denying access due to legal demands
Forbidden – server refuses to authorize request
Not Found – resource could not be found
Payment Required – reserved for future use

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 500 mean?

options.choice: Internal Server Error – generic server error when no more specific message is suitable
Bad Gateway – server received an invalid response from upstream
Service Unavailable – server is currently unavailable
Gateway Timeout – server acting as gateway timed out

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 501 mean?

options.choice: Not Implemented – server does not support the functionality required to fulfill the request
Bad Gateway – server received an invalid response from upstream
Internal Server Error – generic server error
Service Unavailable – server is currently unavailable

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 502 mean?

options.choice: Bad Gateway – server received an invalid response from the upstream server
Gateway Timeout – server acting as gateway timed out
Internal Server Error – generic server error
Service Unavailable – server is currently unavailable

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 503 mean?

options.choice: Service Unavailable – server is currently unable to handle the request
Gateway Timeout – server acting as gateway timed out
Bad Gateway – server received an invalid response from upstream
Internal Server Error – generic server error

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 504 mean?

options.choice: Gateway Timeout – server acting as gateway timed out waiting for upstream server
Request Timeout – client did not produce a request in time
Bad Gateway – server received an invalid response from upstream
Service Unavailable – server is currently unavailable

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 505 mean?

options.choice: HTTP Version Not Supported – server does not support requested HTTP protocol version
Not Implemented – server does not recognize request method
Upgrade Required – client should switch to a different protocol
Internal Server Error – generic server error

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 506 mean?

options.choice: Variant Also Negotiates – transparent content negotiation for the request results in a circular reference
Loop Detected – server detected an infinite loop
Not Extended – further extensions to the request are required

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 507 mean?

options.choice: Insufficient Storage – server is unable to store the representation needed to complete the request
Failed Dependency – request failed due to failure of a previous request
Loop Detected – server detected an infinite loop
Internal Server Error – generic server error

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 508 mean?

options.choice: Loop Detected – server detected an infinite loop while processing the request
Failed Dependency – request failed due to failure of a previous request
Internal Server Error – generic server error
Variant Also Negotiates – circular reference in content negotiation

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 510 mean?

options.choice: Not Extended – further extensions to the request are required for the server to fulfill it
Upgrade Required – client should switch to a different protocol
Unsupported Media Type – server refuses to accept request body format

questions.question: What does HTTP status code 511 mean?

options.choice: Network Authentication Required – client needs to authenticate to gain network access
Proxy Authentication Required – client must authenticate with proxy
Forbidden – server refuses to authorize request
